channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Wales' slate landscape wins World Heritage status
item.description: The north-west slate mining area is said to have "roofed the world" at its height in the 19th Century.

item.title: Snowdon: Two women struck by lightning at summit
item.description: One of the women was more seriously injured by the strike, said mountain rescuers.

item.title: Woman died in Cardiff home after waiting 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: Maria Whale's husband John questioned whether his wife would have lived if help had come sooner.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: How Matt Richards went from garden pool to gold
item.description: Matt Richards' relay swim team almost broke the world record as they won gold in Tokyo.

item.title: Welsh film moves production to Lithuania due to lack of funding
item.description: A film staring Ray Winstone is moving production to Lithuania due to lack of funding in Wales

item.title: Caerphilly lumberjack 'not due to work' when crushed by tree
item.description: Ben Thomas changed his plans when he picked up a new chainsaw and was offered work, inquest hears.

item.title: Covid: Wales to adopt England quarantine rules for EU and US arrivals
item.description: Mark Drakeford says it would be "very hard" not to do so, but asks how vaccine status will be proved.

item.title: Former special constable Phillip Gregory jailed for child sex abuse
item.description: One of Phillip Gregory's victims tells a court he had "stolen" her childhood.

item.title: Eagle eyes spot kestrel chicks in jet plane exhaust
item.description: The young birds "lucky to be alive" after found hiding in exhaust of an Airbus plane during repairs.

item.title: Cardiff kidnapping probe: Police search for Audi Q5
item.description: Twelve people have been charged in connection with the case which has ties to Cardiff and Hertfordshire.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Almost a quarter absent from school at end of term
item.description: Just over 90,000 pupils in Wales were absent from school in the last full week of term, figures show.

item.title: World War Two Arctic Convoys veteran given Royal Navy funeral
item.description: Alan Higgins honoured after surviving being torpedoed, the D-Day landings and World War Two.

item.title: Shielding from Covid: 'I couldn't face going back to work'
item.description: Concerns about contracting Covid, even after being fully vaccinated, sees one woman quit her job.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Matt Richards’ parents ‘overwhelmed’ by gold medal
item.description: "We're just delighted for him", says Matt Richards' mother Amanda.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Lauren Price reaches middleweight quarter-finals
item.description: Team GB's Lauren Price eases through the middleweight round of 16 at the Tokyo Olympics, beating Mongolian Munkhbat Myagmarjargal.

item.title: Waterspout appears off west Wales coast
item.description: Waterspouts occur when a tornado forms over oceans, rivers or lakes.

item.title: Pontyclun beer garden crash survivor 'happy to be alive'
item.description: Darren George said he is just "happy to be alive" despite breaking his leg and ankle in the crash.

item.title: Black representation: ‘I never saw a teacher who looked like me’
item.description: Natalie Jones says teaching did not seem like a possible career choice for her.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Williams' family celebrate silver medal success
item.description: Lauren Williams' sister proud of Tokyo 2020 taekwondo runner-up as family cheer on Welsh star.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win emphatic gold in 4x200m freestyle relay
item.description: Great Britain's men secure another gold in the Olympic pool with a dominant victory in the 4x200m freestyle relay in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Mission accomplished for Gareth Baber's golden Fiji side
item.description: When Gareth Baber was appointed as Fiji Sevens coach in January 2017 he was given the one goal of retaining the Olympics gold medal - which he has now accomplished.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh swimming duo end 109-year wait for Games gold
item.description: You wait 109 years for a Welsh Olympic swimming gold medal and then two come along at once in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain rowers win silver in men's quadruple sculls
item.description: Britain's rowers win their first Olympic medal in the men's quadruple sculls as Harry Leask, Angus Groom, Tom Barras and Jack Beaumont claim silver at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Somerset edge Glamorgan by one run
item.description: Somerset beat Glamorgan by one run in a One-Day Cup thriller at Taunton with 87 from captain Ben Green proving the key contribution.

item.title: Safle Treftadaeth Byd UNESCO i ardal llechi Gwynedd
item.description: Mae Cyngor Gwynedd yn gobeithio y bydd ennill y statws yn arwain at adfywio'r ardal a chreu swyddi newydd.

item.title: Achub dwy 'gafodd eu taro gan fellten' ar Yr Wyddfa
item.description: Dywedodd criw achub bod dwy ddynes wedi derbyn triniaeth, un am fân anafiadau, ac un oedd mewn cyflwr "mwy difrifol".

item.title: Cymru i newid rheolau cwarantin er 'risgiau clir'
item.description: Llywodraeth Cymru'n "gresynu" ar y newid yn Lloegr, ond byddai'n "aneffeithiol" ceisio glynu at reolau gwahanol.

item.title: Fy Stafell i: 'Stydi'r Meuryn' Ceri Wyn Jones
item.description: Meuryn Y Talwrn Ceri Wyn Jones sy'n ein tywys o gwmpas ei stydi

item.title: Morgannwg yn colli o un rhediad yn y Cwpan Undydd
item.description: Boddi wrth ymyl y lan wnaeth Morgannwg yn erbyn Gwlad yr Hâf ar ôl i law fyrhau'r gêm.
